Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Cell

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Cell
public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains information about the state of a single cell. In the game, there are 25 cells and the workers have the possibility to move adn build. Every cell has an actual level (ground, first, second, third or dome), which can change during the match; one worker can be on a cell, otherwise this one is "empty"

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell​(int rowIdentifier, int colIdentifier)
      Cell is the builder of the class. When a cell is created, its level is the ground level and no worker is on it
      Parameters:
      rowIdentifier - the row coordinate of this Cell
      colIdentifier - the col coordinate of this Cell

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      This method checks the emptiness of this Cell.
      Returns:
      true if the cell is empty, false otherwise.

    • getWorker

      public Worker getWorker()
      The method is a simple getter of the worker on the considered cell. If there is no worker on the cell, the return value is 'null'
      Returns:
      the worker on the cell, if there is one (otherwise returns 'null')

    • setWorker

      public void setWorker​(Worker worker)
      The method is a simple setter of the worker on the considered cell.
      Parameters:
      worker - the Worker that must be set for this Cell

    • getLevel

      public BlockType getLevel()
      The method is a simple getter of the level on the considered cell. As described in "BlockType" class, there are five types of different levels: ground, first, second, third and dome
      Returns:
      level of the cell

    • setLevel

      public void setLevel​(BlockType level)
      If a level is empty, the level is changed to that passed as parameter
      Parameters:
      level - the new level to be set for this Cell
      Throws:
      CellNotEmptyException - if the Cell is not currently empty

    • increaseLevel

      public void increaseLevel() throws CannotIncreaseLevelException
      This method is thought to perform a build on the considered cell. Every build increases the level of the cell of one block, if it is possible.
      Throws:
      CannotIncreaseLevelException - is thrown when the level is the highest one (dome), so no increase is possible

    • levelDifference

      public int levelDifference​(Cell cell)
      The method returns the difference between the level of the caller-cell and the level of the parameter-cell, using attribute 'levelNumber' of class 'BlockType'. So, if (for example) the considered cell is level two and the parameter is on the ground, return value will be 2; instead, if the caller is level two and the parameter is level three, return value will be -1. Note that a movement from caller-cell to parameter-cell is possible only if the two cells are adjacent, this method returns a value greater than or equal to -1, the parameter level is not a dome and there is no worker on it
      Parameters:
      cell - cell you want to know level difference with
      Returns:
      level difference between caller-cell and parameter-cell

    • isLevelDifferenceOk

      public boolean isLevelDifferenceOk​(Cell destination)
      The method returns a boolean that represents the possibility to move from caller-cell to parameter-cell, based on level difference between the two cells. Considering only level difference, this method returns true (so the movement is possible) if parameter-cell is at most one level higher than caller-cell. Note that a movement from caller-cell to parameter-cell is possible only if the two cells are adjacent, this method returns true, the parameter level is not a dome and there is no worker on it
      Parameters:
      destination - cell you want to move to
      Returns:
      true if level difference between caller-cell and parameter-cell is greater than or equal to -1

    • getRowIdentifier

      public int getRowIdentifier()
      The method is a getter of the row index of the relative cell in the board.
      Returns:
      the int number that identifies the cell in board's rows.

    • getColIdentifier

      public int getColIdentifier()
      The method is a getter of the column index of the relative cell in the board.
      Returns:
      the int number that identifies the cell in board's columns.

    • isAdjacentTo

      public boolean isAdjacentTo​(Cell other)
      The method controls if the caller-cell is adjacent to the parameter-cell in the board. Reading game rules, every cell has (up to) eight neighbouring spaces: so, two cells are adjacent when they have at least one point in common
      Parameters:
      other - possible adjacent cell to the caller-cell
      Returns:
      true if parameter-cell and caller-cell are adjacent; otherwise, false
